subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized test case pattern
msgSnippet: ... Was it you who said that he always using assertNull(value) without a description? I guess Kent and Erich did the same thing in this place too... :-/ And
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>> Justification? This is just how JUnit resolve test cases.
>>
>>
>I mean: how come the test fails if you fail to call the super constructor
>with a string?
>
>It's so counterintuitive that it tripped even Elliotte... (and myself many
>times).
>
>
Was it you who said that he always using assertNull(value) without a
description? I guess Kent and Erich did the same thing in this place
too... :-/
And many developers don't even bother to look at the exception, not to
mention the source code. :-)

regards,
Eugene
